docs.lead_paragraph: In my Findings column, I discuss reasons for the longevity gap between the United States and most other developed countries. Our shorter life expectancy has often been blamed on the health-care system's failings. But after looking at mortality trends and treatment patterns, Samuel H. Preston and Jessica Y. Ho of the University of Pennsylvania reach another verdict: "We conclude that the low longevity ranking of the United States is not likely to be a result of a poorly functioning health-care system."

headline.main: Is U.S. Health Care System Not the Culprit?

docs.abstract: Could the American health-care system not be guilty of decreasing Americans' life expectancy?
docs.snippet: Could the American health-care system not be guilty of decreasing Americans' life expectancy?

docs.lead_paragraph: New York State is alone among state and city health departments in mandating the vaccinations for influenza and swine flu.

byline.original: By DONALD G. McNEIL Jr. and KAREN ZRAICK

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Sophia Dolly Lin and Dr. James Charles Morrison Brust were married Saturday in New Canaan, Conn. Roberta Koepfer, an interfaith minister affiliated with the Universal Brotherhood Movement, officiated in a house owned by Dr. Brust’s family that was built by the architect Eliot Noyes, who was the bridegroom’s maternal grandfather.

headline.seo: Sophia Lin, James Brust - Weddings and Celebrations

docs.lead_paragraph: The drug maker Merck and Britain's largest charity, the Wellcome Trust, said Thursday they were starting a nonprofit partnership to create affordable vaccines against diseases common in poor countries. The joint research venture will develop vaccines for diseases that lack them and work to improve existing vaccines by finding lower-cost production methods or making them stable at room temperature. Merck and the Wellcome Trust will initially put up equal cash contributions, a total of $130 million over the next seven years. The venture will be based in India and will have about 60 researchers and developers on staff, including some from Merck.
docs.abstract: Merck and Britain's largest charity Wellcome Trust say they are starting nonprofit partnership to create affordable vaccines against diseases common in third world countries (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: T.R. Reid was a bureau chief in Tokyo and London for The Washington Post. His new book, "The Healing of America: A Global Quest for Better, Cheaper, and Fairer Health Care," is a systematic study of the health systems in seven countries that was inspired in part by his family's experiences living overseas and receiving health care abroad. Mr. Reid also produced a 2008 documentary on the same topic for PBS called "Sick Around the World." He spoke with blog contributor Anne Underwood.

headline.main: Health Care Abroad: Questions for T.R. Reid

docs.abstract: Author T.R. Reid examined health care systems in seven developed countries. His verdict: the United States can do better.
docs.snippet: Author T.R. Reid examined health care systems in seven developed countries. His verdict: the United States can do better.
